evidence_span: fracture toughness at maximum pressure $K _ { \mathrm { { C } } }$ decreased rapidly with hydrogen concentration in the region where the concentration was less than $1 0 0 \ \mathsf { p p m }$

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: In the region where the hydrogen concentration was higher than $1 0 0 ~ \mathsf { p p m }$ , $K _ { \mathrm { { C } } }$ slowly decreased with increased concentration

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: For materials having radial hydrides at a hydrogen concentration of 200 to $3 0 0 \ \mathrm { p p m }$ , a steep brittle-ductile transition was observed at about $\bar { 5 } 5 0 \ \mathrm { K }$

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: Fracture toughness $K _ { \mathrm { { C } } }$ shows strong dependence on specimen size, increasing and approaching that of pressure tubes with increased specimen width for a ductile material

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: The pressure tubes of the ATR (Advanced Thermal Reactor: heavy water moderated and light water cooled reactor) prototype "Fugen" are made of heat-treated (HT) $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: The ATR pressure tube contains a fuel assembly and boiling light water coolant at about $5 5 0 ~ \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ under an operating pressure of 7 MPa

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: Zirconium alloys pick up hydrogen under reactor operating conditions

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: circumferential hydride platelets have a tendency to form in the radial-axial plane perpendicular to the hoop stress direction

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_008_chunk6
evidence_span: These concentrated and radial hydrides cause the pressure tube material to significantly decrease in fracture toughness
